subject: [junit] Designing code with JUnit testing in mind
msgSnippet: Anyone got any thoughts on designing and writing their code with consideration to JUnit? I currently keep to loose coupling and use facades a lot to bring
messageBody:
Anyone got any thoughts on designing and writing their code with
consideration to JUnit?
I currently keep to loose coupling and use facades a lot to bring those
packages together.
I dont use inner classes (dont see the need) and keep things (mostly) either
public or private with no inbetween, using protected really only for
operations like template method.


Anyone find any other techniques that help writing tests?
Or just want to flame mine ;-) ?

Joe Heath
Wireless Internet
logica
"Black holes are where God divided by zero."
